1.content:
It was a clear Sunday evening in the middle of November. The skies glowed an orange-red and the hum of traffic from a nearby city was being carried further than what is normally audible by a strong gust of southerly wind. The sound carried far enough so that it could barely heard in a small town a small distance away, James wondered why the noise of the city was so loud tonight, but dismissed it as his mind moved on to other things. James, like any normal 14 year old boy, was always on his phone. Whether it be texting or calling his mates, it is unlikely to see a day in which James wouldn't rack up extra costs for going over his call-time minutes. Today was the eve of James's 15th birthday and despite being told not to, he had already opened most of his cards and has received a fair amount of cash. He decided he needed to buy a replacement for his phone, which although admittedly wasn't old, wasn't the best out of his mates. James always had to be better than them. Colin, one of james's best mates had just gotten a new smartphone and he had been forever gloating to James about it. However, that gloating would stop soon, since Jame's had almost arrived at the largest electronics store in town. However before going in, something caught his eye from across the street, a sign offering the latest blackberry's and what a bargain only $120. He hurried over to the small shop and, not wanting to miss a bargain, rather carelessly ran across the road.

James's entered the small store and began browsing it's wares, He saw the phone advertised outside and walked over to the display model and began examining it. The display picture boasted the message, 'Preloaded with exclusive apps!' How could he resist? Jame's picked up the last model on the shelf and walked over to the counter, a rather timid man stood there, watching as I walked towards him. "Excellent Choice" he said, in a voice that both creeped me out and seemed trustworthy at the same time. It was an odd feeling, but never the less, he rang up the till and took my money. I unboxed the phone there and then and rather hastily threw out the instruction manual, now I was rather tech savvy, but this was no ordinary phone. James took his rather solitary walk home fiddling with the settings, not really paying much attention to where he was going. At one point he almost walked into some elderly lady who was less than pleased with the ignorance of today's youth. After a quick walk home, James's was still clueless as to how to access the exclusive apps but apart from that the phone was brilliant. Should James decided to call it a night, or keep trying to unlock the exclusive apps whose existance was now in question at the moment.
1.title: The Beginning

11.content:
James was beginning to to realize that his efforts were pointless and after all, he had school tomorrow. He was looking forward to it, the chance to boast to Colin but best of all he should be getting a new PS3 for his birthday from his parents. Whilst they might not approve of him spending all his money, they'll be impressed with the bargain he got so James felt that he had nothing to worry about in that regard. James put his new phone on charge, unsure of the probably drained batteries life at the moment. He needed it to be fully ready for tomorrow. After all the phone looks sleek and sexy but what use would that be if it didn't work?

James, unlike a normal night, instantly drifted off to a dream. However this dream had an eerily conscious feel to it. This was the point which, of course, a silhouetted stranger appeared on the opposite side of the room James was standing in. He hadn't really paid much attention to his surroundings, the room was a clean gloss white which had no doors nor windows to speak off. The room was long as rectangular yet seemingly blank and uninhabited, that was of course for the stranger, who was now moving closer. As he came within 3 meters the silhouette effect was lifted and his, or as James now noticed her face became visible.

James stuttered "Erm... Hello".
"Welcome James, you are in a dream like state this was the only way for me to contact you" Replied the mysterious figure.
"Who... Who are you?" Responded James in a manner that showed his nervousness clearly.
"I am Ellen, and you have been chosen" Replied Ellen " Your new phone has the ability to transform people in ways you never thought possible. Age, Gender, Height, Race, Hair, Species and more!"
"What?" Said James blanky
"You heard me, now this power is yours to do with as you like, see it as a gift from the gods" and with that She vanished in an exit befitting a magician.
James then drifted out of the dream and slept until the morning.

1111222121.content:
James decided that he was hungry, and got a banana from the kitchen. It was laying in the fruit basket, which made James feel relieved, because he had no idea which of his kitchen pantries held snacks. As James ate the banana, he began to think (slowly and haltingly) about his new life. Although James knew that things were going to be harder, he felt really nice for some reason. He would have said that he felt carefree, if he still knew the word. James looked down at the Blackberry. He knew how to open it through muscle memory, and it was still displaying the 'Change IQ' screen. There, he saw his new IQ, 35, and some words below it that were too long for him to understand: 'Mentally Handicapped.' James didn't exactly remember how the device worked, but he didn't care. He liked the way things were. He smiled at the Blackberry and said, "I like you."

The doorbell rang, and when James answered it, he saw his friend Zoe. "Hey James!" she said. "Are you ready for our study session?" James didn't know what a 'study session' was, so he just said, "Uhh...yeah!" "Great!" said Zoe. "Can I put my books on the kitchen table?" "Yeah," said James. While putting the books down, Zoe noticed the Blackberry.

"Hey James, did you get a new phone?" she asked.

"Uh...uh-huh," James replied nervously. He instinctively knew that something bad would happen if she looked at the phone too much. Zoe looked at James quizzically. "Are you okay? You seem a lot less talkative than usual." "I fine," James said quickly. "Let's 'stu-dee.'" He was having trouble pronouncing the word he had just re-learned. Zoe looked back at the Blackberry, and said "Can I look at your new phone?" James shook his head, and said "No. I want 'stu-dee.'"

What does Zoe do?
1111222121.title: Yes.

11112221211.content:
Zoe gives you a wry smile and says "I know you're hiding something from me." She looks at the Blackberry, and her smile changes into an expression of shock as she realizes what the phone does. "James, why the hell did you do this to yourself?!" she shouts. "I not know! Just give me!" you say, reaching for the phone. Zoe pulls it back and says, "I'm going to change you back." She sets the device to add 75 points to your IQ (she doesn't know how smart you were exactly, but she figures that you're slightly above average). She presses the button, but you slap the phone before it fires, hitting her instead. The result? Zoe now has an IQ of 175!

"Uh, you imbecile!" she says, rubbing her forehead. "My spontaneous increase in intelligence is giving me a headache!" You weren't paying attention. You were checking yourself to make sure that your intelligence hadn't changed. When you were satisfied, you said, "Yay! I still dumb!" Zoe sighed and said, "Well, if you have such an affinity for being a numskull, I might as well keep you that way." You smiled at her and said "That good idea!" She thinks for a moment and says, "Hmm, maybe it is a good idea. I can observe your behavior and learn more about this device and how it functions. Heck, I could even perform experiments!" None of this made any sense to you, but you nodded anyway, because she wasn't talking about making you smart. "You can go watch TV, James." You walk over to the couch and turn on the TV. The news is on, but it's very complicated, so you change the channel. You find a nature documentary, which you still can't understand, but you like the pictures, so you continue to watch it. Meanwhile, Zoe is taking notes in one of her binders. You ask her, "When you going?" She looks at you and says "Silly, I live here, remember?" Your memory isn't very good, so, as far as you know, she does live in your house. "Okay," you reply. Zoe keeps taking notes.

After taking notes, Zoe examines the phone more closely. She sees of set of sliders in the 'Intelligence" section. Each slider corresponds to an academic skill, and so she sets the slider for 'Math' at 100% and shoots you with with the phone. You don't feel different, but when she asks you what 2+2 is, you realize that you're able to do it. Zoe gives you several more addition and subtraction problems, which you do with ease. info.brief_description: James new phone has the ability to transform people and to make people not notice changes.
info.description:
Right, Hi, As you will probably know either by figuring out this is my first story or by what you are about to read, I am new here.
This is my first story

KEEP CONTINUITY PLEASE! HIS FRIEND DOES NOT CHANGE NAME RANDOMLY.
The story is about the main character, James, who buys a new phone on the cheap. However the phone comes preloaded with some software that is not so standard, soon enough chaos breaks out and James has the power to transform himself and his friends.
The device has the ability to change people in various ways, Partial or fully, so that the rest of the world (including the person transformed(excluding James) thinks it's always been like that) Or where everyone notices.

Some basic rules:
1. No killing the main character
2. No personality changes
3. Try to keep good grammar
4. The device can only be operated by James.
5. No other devices with powers similar to the first one
6. No Sex etc Keep it 13.

7. I reserver the right to change chapters/delete chapters if I feel they are inappropriate or don't go where I think the story should be heading. I would like you to contribute but please more than one liners that can ruin a story.

Thanks, Please Contribute.

Ellen
